business.headline: Swipe, spend, struggle: How credit card defaults are spiking in IndiaOnce a symbol of freedom, credit cards now trap young Indians in growing debt. Could defaults be the new norm?

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status, other detailsKRN Heat Exchanger opened for subscription on September 25 looking to raise Rs 341.95 crore from its public issue, and has already seen bids of over 80 times.

Accenture guidance boost lifts Infosys, Wipro; IT stocks rally up to 4%Accenture not only exceeded market expectations for its Q4 results but also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to a range of 3-6%.

Isha, Akash Ambani among top young entrepreneurs in Hurun's under-35 listThe Hurun list celebrates 150 entrepreneurs aged 35 or younger from across India, marking their achievements in fields ranging from retail to tech startups.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high for 6th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex added 67.47 points to 85,903.59, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.70 points to 26,230.75.

Swiggy files for IPO, aims to raise about Rs 3,750 croreSwiggy, backed by investment group Prosus and Japan's SoftBank, competes with Zomato in India's online restaurant and cafe food deliveries sector.

Will Middle East conflict dampen Dalal Street's rally? Here's what experts say Despite the uncertainty arising from the Middle East conflict, Indian stocks have surged, with benchmarks like the Sensex and Nifty showing strong gains.

Vedanta shares cross Rs 500 mark after gaining 5%. More gains ahead?Vedanta's performance in 2024 has been impressive, with the stock climbing 95% so far this year and gaining 124.35% over the last 12 months. Over a five-year period, the stock has risen by 202%.
Sensex, Nifty close at all-time high led by rally in auto and metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 666.25 points to end at 85,836.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 211.90 points to close at 26,216.05.
Tata Steel shares gain for 5th straight session. What should investors do?In the past year, Tata Steel has rallied 28%, with an 18% gain so far in 2024.

Trent shares surge to record high on Citi's 'buy' call. Check detailsCiti set a target price of Rs 9,250 for the stock, signaling a 21% upside from the previous closing price, and added it to its Pan-Asia high-conviction focus list.

Puneet Chhatwal eyes top 3 spot for Taj Hotels in global hospitalityHe envisions the brand securing its place among the top three global hospitality companies in the next five years, a goal driven by Taj's ethos of service, adaptability to changing luxury trends, and a commitment to sustainable growth.

80% of your portfolio should be 'Dal-Chawal': Radhika Gupta's investment mantraRadhika Gupta's message focused on the importance of disciplined, long-term investing—what she calls "Dal-Chawal Investing"—a simple and sustainable approach she believes will help investors navigate the market's highs and lows.

Diffusion Engineers IPO opens for subscription: Should you subcribe?The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 159 and Rs 168 per share. Investors can apply for a minimum lot of 88 shares, requiring a retail investment of Rs 14,784.
Manba Finance IPO allotment: Check status, expected listing gain, subscriptionManba Finance IPO opened for subscription on September 23 and ran until September 25, generating huge bids.

Hyundai Motors IPO: Can it beat Maruti Suzuki's market valuation?Hyundai, the second-largest automaker in India, has maintained a steady market share of 15-17% since 2008. But does it have what it takes to beat market leader Maruti Suzuki's valuation?

Gold, silver price today, September 26, 2024: Yellow metal records dip, silver trades higher on MCXGold Price Today 26 September 2024: Gold is trading on the lower side while silver rates have recorded a hike on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Thursday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high as rally extends for 5th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex rose to an all-time high of 85,333.23 in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed to 26,056.

Hyundai to Swiggy: 5 big IPOs set to light up Dalal Street before 2024 endsFrom Hyundai Motors' massive offering to Swiggy's much-anticipated debut, the year's final IPOs could be the most exciting ones yet.

Sensex, Nifty hit record high as power and financial stock drive market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 255.83 points to end at 85,169.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.75 points to close at 26,004.15.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: India's bid for permanent UN Security Council seat gets major push UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday backed India for a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) during his address at the United Nations General Assembly's 79th session in New York.

'Human sacrifice' in UP, Class 2 boy strangled to bring 'glory to school'The alleged motive behind the murder was to ensure the prosperity of the school, which had been under financial strain. The accused believed that offering a human sacrifice would lead to the school's success.

Heavy rain pounds Mumbai, red alert issued, showers to continue throughout weekThe IMD has issued a red alert for Nashik, while orange alerts have been placed for Palghar, Pune, Nandurbar, and Dhule. Additionally, nearly every city in Maharashtra is under a yellow alert for the day.

Why Turkey's Erdogan skipped Kashmir in speech, rattled Pakistan | ExplainedTurkey's President Erdogan omits Kashmir in his UNGA speech. What could signal a potential shift in Turkey's stance, is seen as a blow to Pakistan, and it's futile 'activism' for Kashmir. The move could be linked to Turkey's aspirations to join the BRICS group, and strengthening ties with India.

Wants to cut pay: Saif on Karan Johar's 'stars can't guarantee hits' remarkSaif Ali Khan, speaking at India Today Mumbai Conclave 2024, said that actors charging astronomical amounts and not delivering cannot last for long in the industry.

Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus reveals 'brains' behind Sheikh Hasina's ousterSpeaking at the Clinton Global Initiative, Dr Muhammad Yunus introduced and praised the young leaders who drove the student-led movement that led to Sheikh Hasina's ouster.

Dharavi project under state control: Devendra Fadnavis rebuts 'Adani City' chargeDevendra Fadnavis, speaking at India Today's Mumbai Conclave, alleged that the previous Uddhav Thackeray government failed to cap the Transferable Development Rights of the project.

Flipkart apologises for video calling husbands 'aalsi, bewakoof' after backlashThe video, promoting Flipkart's 'Big Billion Days Sale,' has since been removed from their social media platforms after the backlash.

Are ISI, China out to derail Waqf Bill amendment?The huge number of suggestions that the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) has got in the Waqf (Amendment) Bill has sparked a controversy. Panel member and BJP MP Nishikant Dubey sought a probe into the role of China or Pakistan's ISI over the 1.35 crore feedback. The All India Muslim Personal Law Board said Muslims had sent 5 crore responses to the JPC against the bill.

Devara X review: Fans 'blown away' by Jr NTR's performance, but disappointed by VFXJr NTR's Devara: Part 1 made its grand theatrical debut on September 27. While the superstar's performance is being praised on social media, the VFX used in the film drew flak.

Isha, Akash Ambani among top young entrepreneurs in Hurun's under-35 listThe Hurun list celebrates 150 entrepreneurs aged 35 or younger from across India, marking their achievements in fields ranging from retail to tech startups.

Shigeru Ishiba, 67, is Japan's new PM after winning closely fought pollsShigeru Ishiba will be sworn in as Japan's 102nd Prime Minister by the Diet on October 1, the same day Fumio Kishida officially steps down from the role.

RG Kar hangs heavy on Durga Puja 2024, Bengalis debate to celebrate or notDurga Puja is not just a festival but an emotion for all Bengalis, but this year, people feel a strange hesitation to celebrate it. With Kolkata being the ground zero of a heinous rape and murder, here's how the community is prepping for the upcoming festivities.

Hezbollah drone chief killed as Netanyahu vows to strike Lebanon with full forceIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reiterated that Israel will continue its "full force" strikes against Hezbollah, dampening hopes for a proposed 21-day ceasefire advocated by US and European officials.

Man throws acid on wife's face after she discovers his affair, asks for divorceThe couple had a love marriage in 2019, and soon after, the woman learnt about her husband's unemployment, drug addiction and extramarital affair.

Saif Ali Khan calls Adipurush controversy 'unsettling': Not here to make troubleSaif Ali Khan discussed the Adipurush controversy at the India Today Conclave 2024, calling the legal issues 'unsettling'. He emphasised the need for caution regarding sensitive topics like religion.

Binny and Family review: Debutante Anjini Dhawan is impressive, plot not so muchReleased-Fri Sep 27, 2024Binny and Family explores the generational gap through the lens of Binny, a girl balancing her modern life with her traditional family's expectations. While beautifully shot and featuring strong performances by Pankaj Kapur and Anjini Dhawan, it suffers from clichés and fatigue.

Rohit Sharma's contrasting reactions to DRS decisions in Kanpur Test go viral India vs Bangladesh: Indian captain Rohit Sharma's animated reactions to two crucial DRS calls on Day 1 of the second Test against Bangladesh in Kanpur have gone viral.
Law student caught on wrong side of law to fulfill girlfriends's lavish demandsIn Lucknow, a law student resorted to theft to meet his girlfriend's expensive demands, leading to his arrest.

Polls to Delhi civic body's key panel today after AAP, Lt Governor face-offThe Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is set to conduct the highly contentious election for the sixth seat on its Standing Committee today following a political standoff between the AAP and Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena.

Video: Karan Johar, Taha Shah leave for Abu Dhabi to attend IIFA 2024Filmmaker Karan Johar and actor Taha Shah Badussha were clicked at the Mumbai airport on September 27. The two left for Abu Dhabi to attend IIFA 2024.

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 teaser: Vidya Balan's Manjulika gives you thrills in a scary rideThe much-anticipated Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 teaser, starring Kartik Aaryan, is here. The makers have introduced every character in the video, marking a grand and a celebratory comeback of Vidya Balan as the OG Manjulika.

Taarak Mehta's Palak Sidhwani accuses makers of 'exploitation' after quitting showActor Palak Sidhwani, who plays the role of Sonu Bhide in Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah, accused the production of making her exit difficult from the show. She said she never breached her contract and yet the makers are exploiting her.

AP Dhillon announces India tour, shares dates for 3-city tourSinger-rapper AP Dhillon announced his much-awaited India tour. He shared the official dates of his upcoming The Brownprint tour on social media on September 27.

sports.headline: Watch: Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja imitate Jasprit Bumrah's bowling actionIndia vs Bangladesh, 2nd Test: Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja were seen copying Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action and his routine of returning to the mark after delivering the ball.

Dwayne Bravo recalls Shah Rukh Khan's party message after joining KKR as mentorIPL 2025: Former West Indies all-rounder recalled Shah Rukh Khan's message after he was appointed the mentor of the Knight Riders. Bravo also thanked the Chennai Super Kings for 'blessing' him for the next chapter of his cricketing journey.

Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag backs Bruno Fernandes to regain formManchester United boss Erik ten Hag has backed captain Bruno Fernandes to bounce back after his sluggish start to the new campaign. Fernandes is yet to score a goal this season for United.

Watch: Virat Kohli's feet touched by Kanpur ground staff member before 2nd TestA member of the Green Park ground staff decided to approach Virat Kohli and proceeded to touch Virat Kohli's feet in a heartwarming moment on Friday, September 27. Kohli is aiming to make an impact in the Kanpur Test.

India become first team to win toss and bowl first in Kanpur Test in 60 years India vs Bangladesh, 2nd Test: Rohit Sharma called it right at the toss and opted to field at Green Park. This is the first time in 60 years that a team has won the toss in Kanpur and opted to bowl.

Kohli has been going through a rough patch in the longest format of the game.

IPL 2025: Dwayne Bravo appointed new KKR mentor, replaces Gautam GambhirIPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders announced former West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo as their mentor for the upcoming Indian Premier League season. Bravo's association with Chennai Super Kings, therefore, comes to an end.

IND vs BAN: India sticks to Chennai winning mantra in Kanpur Test, no 3rd spinnerIndia has decided to stick with the same team that won them the Chennai Test in Kanpur as they will use 3 pacers instead of using an extra spinner.

Hull sustained the injury during his Test debut against Sri Lanka, further depleting England's pace options.

Shakib Al Hasan's security not in our hands: Bangladesh cricket board presidentBangladesh cricket board president Faruque Ahmed has claimed that they cannot guarantee Shakib Al Hasan's security if the all-rounder wants to play his final Test on home soil. Shakib announced his retirement from Tests on September 26 and wanted to play his last game in Mirpur.

WI great Dwayne Bravo retires from all forms of cricket: Champion bids farewellVeteran West Indian cricketer Dwayne Bravo has retired from all forms of cricket just before his 41st birthday, concluding an illustrious 21-year career. Bravo's final appearance was cut short by an injury during the 2024 Caribbean Premier League.

2nd Test Kanpur Weather Report: Rain likely to play spoilsport on Day 1India vs Bangladesh, Kanpur Weather Report: The second Test between India and Bangladesh at Green Park could face weather disruptions, with rain and thunderstorms predicted on Day 1. According to AccuWeather, thunderstorms are expected throughout Friday, potentially affecting the start of the match.

IND vs BAN Statistical Preview: Virat Kohli, R Ashwin eye major feats in KanpurIND vs BAN: Virat Kohli, Ravi Ashwin, Mushfiqur Rahim, Mehidy Hasan Miraz and others have the chance to rack up records in the second Test starting September 27 in Kanpur.

IND vs BAN: UPCA rubbishes claims of unsafe stands in Green Park Stadium, KanpurUPCA venue director Sanjay Kapoor has rubbished claims of unsafe stands at the Green Park in Kanpur ahead of the second Test between India and Bangladesh.

Conclave Mumbai: Manu Bhaker shoots gold in rapid fire roundIndia shooter Manu Bhaker was put in the spotlight for a rapid fire round at the India Today Conclave in Mumbai where she opened up on her second favourite sport, her alternate profession and her admiration for MS Dhoni: The Untold Story.

Liam Lawson to replace Daniel Ricciardo at RB for rest of F1 seasonNew Zealander Liam Lawson will take over from Australian Daniel Ricciardo for the final six races of the Formula One season, as announced by the Red Bull-owned RB team.

Yuvraj Singh smartly dodges controversial Virat-Dhoni question with witty answerFormer India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh dodged a controversial question when he was asked to choose between Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni.

Pitches don't matter against teams like India: Shakib Al Hasan IND vs BAN: Shakib Al Hasan said that Bangladesh need to put in a better before if they are to make a comeback in the second Test against India at the Green Park in Kanpur.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
